summary.long: Jeremiah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The words of Jeremiah, the son of Hilkiah, one of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom the word of the Lord came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came also in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, and until the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the captivity of Jerusalem in the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God! Behold, I do not know how to speak, for I am only a youth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord put out his hand and touched my mouth. And the Lord said to me,
“Behold, I have put my words in your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
See, I have set you this day over nations and over kingdoms,
to pluck up and to break down,
to destroy and to overthrow,
to build and to plant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying, “Jeremiah, what do you see?” And I said, “I see an almond branch.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “You have seen well, for I am watching over my word to perform it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me a second time, saying, “What do you see?” And I said, “I see a boiling pot, facing away from the north.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Out of the north disaster shall be let loose upon all the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I am calling all the tribes of the kingdoms of the north, declares the Lord, and they shall come, and every one shall set his throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, against all its walls all around and against all the cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will declare my judgments against them, for all their evil in forsaking me. They have made offerings to other gods and worshiped the works of their own hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, dress yourself for work; arise, and say to them everything that I command you. Do not be dismayed by them, lest I dismay you before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, behold, I make you this day a fortified city, an iron pillar, and bronze walls, against the whole land, against the kings of Judah, its officials, its priests, and the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fight against you, but they shall not prevail against you, for I am with you, declares the Lord, to deliver you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go and proclaim in the hearing of Jerusalem, Thus says the Lord,
“I remember the devotion of your youth,
    your love as a bride,
how you followed me in the wilderness,
    in a land not sown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel was holy to the Lord,
    the firstfruits of his harvest.
All who ate of it incurred guilt;
    disaster came upon them,
declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word of the Lord, O house of Jacob, and all the clans of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“What wrong did your fathers find in me
    that they went far from me,
and went after worthlessness, and became worthless?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not say, ‘Where is the Lord
    who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
who led us in the wilderness,
    in a land of deserts and pits,
in a land of drought and deep darkness,
    in a land that none passes through,
    where no man dwells?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I brought you into a plentiful land
    to enjoy its fruits and its good things.
But when you came in, you defiled my land
    and made my heritage an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I still contend with you,
declares the Lord,
    and with your children's children I will contend.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Has a nation changed its gods,
    even though they are no gods?
But my people have changed their glory
    for that which does not profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
for my people have committed two evils:
they have forsaken me,
    the fountain of living waters,
and hewed out cisterns for themselves,
    broken cisterns that can hold no water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is Israel a slave? Is he a homeborn servant?
    Why then has he become a prey?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover, the men of Memphis and Tahpanhes
    have shaved the crown of your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not brought this upon yourself
    by forsaking the Lord your God,
    when he led you in the way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now what do you gain by going to Egypt
    to drink the waters of the Nile?
Or what do you gain by going to Assyria
    to drink the waters of the Euphrates?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your evil will chastise you,
    and your apostasy will reprove you.
Know and see that it is evil and bitter
    for you to forsake the Lord your God;
    the fear of me is not in you,
declares the Lord God of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For long ago I broke your yoke
    and burst your bonds;
    but you said, ‘I will not serve.’
Yes, on every high hill
    and under every green tree
    you bowed down like a whore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I planted you a choice vine,
    wholly of pure seed.
How then have you turned degenerate
    and become a wild vine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you wash yourself with lye
    and use much soap,
    the stain of your guilt is still before me,
declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How can you say, ‘I am not unclean,
    I have not gone after the Baals’?
Look at your way in the valley;
    know what you have done—
a restless young camel running here and there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a wild donkey used to the wilderness,
in her heat sniffing the wind!
    Who can restrain her lust?
None who seek her need weary themselves;
    in her month they will find her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your feet from going unshod
    and your throat from thirst.
But you said, ‘It is hopeless,
    for I have loved foreigners,
    and after them I will go.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“As a thief is shamed when caught,
    so the house of Israel shall be shamed:
they, their kings, their officials,
    their priests, and their prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who say to a tree, ‘You are my father,’
    and to a stone, ‘You gave me birth.’
For they have turned their back to me,
    and not their face.
But in the time of their trouble they say,
    ‘Arise and save us!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But where are your gods
    that you made for yourself?
Let them arise, if they can save you,
    in your time of trouble;
for as many as your cities
    are your gods, O Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Why do you contend with me?
    You have all transgressed against me,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And you, O generation, behold the word of the Lord.
Have I been a wilderness to Israel,
    or a land of thick darkness?
Why then do my people say, ‘We are free,
    we will come no more to you’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a virgin forget her ornaments,
    or a bride her attire?
Yet my people have forgotten me
    days without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How well you direct your course
    to seek love!
So that even to wicked women
    you have taught your ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also on your skirts is found
    the lifeblood of the guiltless poor;
you did not find them breaking in.
    Yet in spite of all these things
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you say, ‘I am innocent;
    surely his anger has turned from me.’
Behold, I will bring you to judgment
    for saying, ‘I have not sinned.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much you go about,
    changing your way!
You shall be put to shame by Egypt
    as you were put to shame by Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From it too you will come away
    with your hands on your head,
for the Lord has rejected those in whom you trust,
    and you will not prosper by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If a man divorces his wife
    and she goes from him
and becomes another man's wife,
    will he return to her?
Would not that land be greatly polluted?
You have played the whore with many lovers;
    and would you return to me?
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lift up your eyes to the bare heights, and see!
    Where have you not been ravished?
By the waysides you have sat awaiting lovers
    like an Arab in the wilderness.
You have polluted the land
    with your vile whoredom.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Have you not just now called to me,
    ‘My father, you are the friend of my youth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
will he be angry forever,
    will he be indignant to the end?’
Behold, you have spoken,
    but you have done all the evil that you could.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me in the days of King Josiah: “Have you seen what she did, that faithless one, Israel, how she went up on every high hill and under every green tree, and there played the whore?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I thought, ‘After she has done all this she will return to me,’ but she did not return, and her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw that for all the adulteries of that faithless one, Israel, I had sent her away with a decree of divorce. Yet her treacherous sister Judah did not fear, but she too went and played the whore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because she took her whoredom lightly, she polluted the land, committing adultery with stone and tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet for all this her treacherous sister Judah did not return to me with her whole heart, but in pretense, declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “Faithless Israel has shown herself more righteous than treacherous Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say,
“‘Return, faithless Israel,
declares the Lord.
I will not look on you in anger,
    for I am merciful,
declares the Lord;
I will not be angry forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only acknowledge your guilt,
    that you rebelled against the Lord your God
and scattered your favors among foreigners under every green tree,
    and that you have not obeyed my voice,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “‘And I will give you shepherds after my own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you have multiplied and been fruitful in the land, in those days, declares the Lord, they shall no more say, “The ark of the covenant of the Lord.” It shall not come to mind or be remembered or missed; it shall not be made again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time Jerusalem shall be called the throne of the Lord, and all nations shall gather to it, to the presence of the Lord in Jerusalem, and they shall no more stubbornly follow their own evil heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days the house of Judah shall join the house of Israel, and together they shall come from the land of the north to the land that I gave your fathers for a heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘I said,
    How I would set you among my sons,
and give you a pleasant land,
    a heritage most beautiful of all nations.
And I thought you would call me, My Father,
    and would not turn from following me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely, as a treacherous wife leaves her husband,
    so have you been treacherous to me, O house of Israel,
declares the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice on the bare heights is heard,
    the weeping and pleading of Israel's sons
because they have perverted their way;
    they have forgotten the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Return, O faithless sons;
    I will heal your faithlessness.”
“Behold, we come to you,
    for you are the Lord our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Truly the hills are a delusion,
    the orgies on the mountains.
Truly in the Lord our God
    is the salvation of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But from our youth the shameful thing has devoured all for which our fathers labored, their flocks and their herds, their sons and their daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us lie down in our shame, and let our dishonor cover us. For we have sinned against the Lord our God, we and our fathers, from our youth even to this day, and we have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you return, O Israel,
declares the Lord,
    to me you should return.
If you remove your detestable things from my presence,
    and do not waver,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and if you swear, ‘As the Lord lives,’
    in truth, in justice, and in righteousness,
then nations shall bless themselves in him,
    and in him shall they glory.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord to the men of Judah and Jerusalem:
“Break up your fallow ground,
    and sow not among thorns.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Declare in Judah, and proclaim in Jerusalem, and say,
“Blow the trumpet through the land;
    cry aloud and say,
‘Assemble, and let us go
    into the fortified cities!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Raise a standard toward Zion,
    flee for safety, stay not,
for I bring disaster from the north,
    and great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For this put on sackcloth,
    lament and wail,
for the fierce anger of the Lord
    has not turned back from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In that day, declares the Lord, courage shall fail both king and officials. The priests shall be appalled and the prophets astounded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God, surely you have utterly deceived this people and Jerusalem, saying, ‘It shall be well with you,’ whereas the sword has reached their very life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, “A hot wind from the bare heights in the desert toward the daughter of my people, not to winnow or cleanse,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a wind too full for this comes for me. Now it is I who speak in judgment upon them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O Jerusalem, wash your heart from evil,
    that you may be saved.
How long shall your wicked thoughts
    lodge within you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a voice declares from Dan
    and proclaims trouble from Mount Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Like keepers of a field are they against her all around,
    because she has rebelled against me,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your ways and your deeds
    have brought this upon you.
This is your doom, and it is bitter;
    it has reached your very heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Crash follows hard on crash;
    the whole land is laid waste.
Suddenly my tents are laid waste,
    my curtains in a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long must I see the standard
    and hear the sound of the trumpet?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I looked on the earth, and behold, it was without form and void;
    and to the heavens, and they had no light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked on the mountains, and behold, they were quaking,
    and all the hills moved to and fro.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, and behold, there was no man,
    and all the birds of the air had fled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I looked, and behold, the fruitful land was a desert,
    and all its cities were laid in ruins
    before the Lord, before his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord, “The whole land shall be a desolation; yet I will not make a full end.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And you, O desolate one,
what do you mean that you dress in scarlet,
    that you adorn yourself with ornaments of gold,
    that you enlarge your eyes with paint?
In vain you beautify yourself.
    Your lovers despise you;
    they seek your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I heard a cry as of a woman in labor,
    anguish as of one giving birth to her first child,
the cry of the daughter of Zion gasping for breath,
    stretching out her hands,
“Woe is me! I am fainting before murderers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Run to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem,
    look and take note!
Search her squares to see
    if you can find a man,
one who does justice
    and seeks truth,
that I may pardon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they say, “As the Lord lives,”
    yet they swear falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, do not your eyes look for truth?
You have struck them down,
    but they felt no anguish;
you have consumed them,
    but they refused to take correction.
They have made their faces harder than rock;
    they have refused to repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“How can I pardon you?
    Your children have forsaken me
    and have sworn by those who are no gods.
When I fed them to the full,
    they committed adultery
    and trooped to the houses of whores.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were well-fed, lusty stallions,
    each neighing for his neighbor's wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I not punish them for these things?
declares the Lord;
    and shall I not avenge myself
    on a nation such as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up through her vine rows and destroy,
    but make not a full end;
strip away her branches,
    for they are not the Lord's.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the house of Israel and the house of Judah
    have been utterly treacherous to me,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have spoken falsely of the Lord
    and have said, ‘He will do nothing;
no disaster will come upon us,
    nor shall we see sword or famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord, the God of hosts:
“Because you have spoken this word,
behold, I am making my words in your mouth a fire,
    and this people wood, and the fire shall consume them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I am bringing against you
    a nation from afar, O house of Israel,
declares the Lord.
It is an enduring nation;
    it is an ancient nation,
a nation whose language you do not know,
    nor can you understand what they say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their quiver is like an open tomb;
    they are all mighty warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “But even in those days, declares the Lord, I will not make a full end of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when your people say, ‘Why has the Lord our God done all these things to us?’ you shall say to them, ‘As you have forsaken me and served foreign gods in your land, so you shall serve foreigners in a land that is not yours.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare this in the house of Jacob;
    proclaim it in Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear this, O foolish and senseless people,
    who have eyes, but see not,
    who have ears, but hear not.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But this people has a stubborn and rebellious heart;
    they have turned aside and gone away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They do not say in their hearts,
    ‘Let us fear the Lord our God,
who gives the rain in its season,
    the autumn rain and the spring rain,
and keeps for us
    the weeks appointed for the harvest.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your iniquities have turned these away,
    and your sins have kept good from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
they have grown fat and sleek.
They know no bounds in deeds of evil;
    they judge not with justice
the cause of the fatherless, to make it prosper,
    and they do not defend the rights of the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I not punish them for these things?
declares the Lord,
    and shall I not avenge myself
    on a nation such as this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An appalling and horrible thing
    has happened in the land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the prophets prophesy falsely,
    and the priests rule at their direction;
my people love to have it so,
    but what will you do when the end comes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Flee for safety, O people of Benjamin,
    from the midst of Jerusalem!
Blow the trumpet in Tekoa,
    and raise a signal on Beth-haccherem,
for disaster looms out of the north,
    and great destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lovely and delicately bred I will destroy,
    the daughter of Zion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Prepare war against her;
    arise, and let us attack at noon!
Woe to us, for the day declines,
    for the shadows of evening lengthen!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, and let us attack by night
    and destroy her palaces!”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be warned, O Jerusalem,
    lest I turn from you in disgust,
lest I make you a desolation,
    an uninhabited land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts:
“They shall glean thoroughly as a vine
    the remnant of Israel;
like a grape gatherer pass your hand again
    over its branches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their houses shall be turned over to others,
    their fields and wives together,
for I will stretch out my hand
    against the inhabitants of the land,”
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For from the least to the greatest of them,
    everyone is greedy for unjust gain;
and from prophet to priest,
    everyone deals falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have healed the wound of my people lightly,
    saying, ‘Peace, peace,’
    when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Stand by the roads, and look,
    and ask for the ancient paths,
where the good way is; and walk in it,
    and find rest for your souls.
But they said, ‘We will not walk in it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I set watchmen over you, saying,
    ‘Pay attention to the sound of the trumpet!’
But they said, ‘We will not pay attention.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear, O nations,
    and know, O congregation, what will happen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O earth; behold, I am bringing disaster upon this people,
    the fruit of their devices,
because they have not paid attention to my words;
    and as for my law, they have rejected it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What use to me is frankincense that comes from Sheba,
    or sweet cane from a distant land?
Your burnt offerings are not acceptable,
    nor your sacrifices pleasing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
‘Behold, I will lay before this people
    stumbling blocks against which they shall stumble;
fathers and sons together,
    neighbor and friend shall perish.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Behold, a people is coming from the north country,
    a great nation is stirring from the farthest parts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Go not out into the field,
    nor walk on the road,
for the enemy has a sword;
    terror is on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O daughter of my people, put on sackcloth,
    and roll in ashes;
make mourning as for an only son,
    most bitter lamentation,
for suddenly the destroyer
    will come upon us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have made you a tester of metals among my people,
    that you may know and test their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Rejected silver they are called,
    for the Lord has rejected them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stand in the gate of the Lord's house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of the Lord, all you men of Judah who enter these gates to worship the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Amend your ways and your deeds, and I will let you dwell in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not trust in these deceptive words: ‘This is the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord, the temple of the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For if you truly amend your ways and your deeds, if you truly execute justice one with another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you do not oppress the sojourner, the fatherless, or the widow, or shed innocent blood in this place, and if you do not go after other gods to your own harm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will let you dwell in this place, in the land that I gave of old to your fathers forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, you trust in deceptive words to no avail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, make offerings to Baal, and go after other gods that you have not known,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then come and stand before me in this house, which is called by my name, and say, ‘We are delivered!’—only to go on doing all these abominations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes? Behold, I myself have seen it, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go now to my place that was in Shiloh, where I made my name dwell at first, and see what I did to it because of the evil of my people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, because you have done all these things, declares the Lord, and when I spoke to you persistently you did not listen, and when I called you, you did not answer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore I will do to the house that is called by my name, and in which you trust, and to the place that I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will cast you out of my sight, as I cast out all your kinsmen, all the offspring of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, do not pray for this people, or lift up a cry or prayer for them, and do not intercede with me, for I will not hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children gather wood, the fathers kindle fire, and the women knead dough, to make cakes for the queen of heaven. And they pour out drink offerings to other gods, to provoke me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it I whom they provoke? declares the Lord. Is it not themselves, to their own shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Behold, my anger and my wrath will be poured out on this place, upon man and beast, upon the trees of the field and the fruit of the ground; it will burn and not be quenched.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices, and eat the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, I did not speak to your fathers or command them concerning burnt offerings and sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this command I gave them: ‘Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and you shall be my people. And walk in all the way that I command you, that it may be well with you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they did not obey or incline their ear, but walked in their own counsels and the stubbornness of their evil hearts, and went backward and not forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the day that your fathers came out of the land of Egypt to this day, I have persistently sent all my servants the prophets to them, day after day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not listen to me or incline their ear, but stiffened their neck. They did worse than their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you shall speak all these words to them, but they will not listen to you. You shall call to them, but they will not answer you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say to them, ‘This is the nation that did not obey the voice of the Lord their God, and did not accept discipline; truth has perished; it is cut off from their lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“‘Cut off your hair and cast it away;
    raise a lamentation on the bare heights,
for the Lord has rejected and forsaken
    the generation of his wrath.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For the sons of Judah have done evil in my sight, declares the Lord. They have set their detestable things in the house that is called by my name, to defile it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they have built the high places of Topheth, which is in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to burn their sons and their daughters in the fire, which I did not command, nor did it come into my mind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when it will no more be called Topheth, or the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter; for they will bury in Topheth, because there is no room elsewhere.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dead bodies of this people will be food for the birds of the air, and for the beasts of the earth, and none will frighten them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will silence in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, for the land shall become a waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time, declares the Lord, the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of its officials, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem shall be brought out of their tombs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall be spread before the sun and the moon and all the host of heaven, which they have loved and served, which they have gone after, and which they have sought and worshiped. And they shall not be gathered or buried. They shall be as dung on the surface of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Death shall be preferred to life by all the remnant that remains of this evil family in all the places where I have driven them, declares the Lord of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall say to them, Thus says the Lord:
When men fall, do they not rise again?
    If one turns away, does he not return?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why then has this people turned away
    in perpetual backsliding?
They hold fast to deceit;
    they refuse to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have paid attention and listened,
    but they have not spoken rightly;
no man relents of his evil,
    saying, ‘What have I done?’
Everyone turns to his own course,
    like a horse plunging headlong into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the stork in the heavens
    knows her times,
and the turtledove, swallow, and crane
    keep the time of their coming,
but my people know not
    the rules of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can you say, ‘We are wise,
    and the law of the Lord is with us’?
But behold, the lying pen of the scribes
    has made it into a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have healed the wound of my people lightly,
    saying, ‘Peace, peace,’
    when there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When I would gather them, declares the Lord,
    there are no grapes on the vine,
    nor figs on the fig tree;
even the leaves are withered,
    and what I gave them has passed away from them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do we sit still?
Gather together; let us go into the fortified cities
    and perish there,
for the Lord our God has doomed us to perish
    and has given us poisoned water to drink,
    because we have sinned against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We looked for peace, but no good came;
    for a time of healing, but behold, terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The snorting of their horses is heard from Dan;
    at the sound of the neighing of their stallions
    the whole land quakes.
They come and devour the land and all that fills it,
    the city and those who dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For behold, I am sending among you serpents,
    adders that cannot be charmed,
    and they shall bite you,”
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My joy is gone; grief is upon me;
    my heart is sick within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the cry of the daughter of my people
    from the length and breadth of the land:
“Is the Lord not in Zion?
    Is her King not in her?”
“Why have they provoked me to anger with their carved images
    and with their foreign idols?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The harvest is past, the summer is ended,
    and we are not saved.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the wound of the daughter of my people is my heart wounded;
    I mourn, and dismay has taken hold on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there no balm in Gilead?
    Is there no physician there?
Why then has the health of the daughter of my people
    not been restored?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my head were waters,
    and my eyes a fountain of tears,
that I might weep day and night
    for the slain of the daughter of my people!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I had in the desert
    a travelers' lodging place,
that I might leave my people
    and go away from them!
For they are all adulterers,
    a company of treacherous men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let everyone beware of his neighbor,
    and put no trust in any brother,
for every brother is a deceiver,
    and every neighbor goes about as a slanderer.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Heaping oppression upon oppression, and deceit upon deceit,
    they refuse to know me, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts:
“Behold, I will refine them and test them,
    for what else can I do, because of my people?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Shall I not punish them for these things? declares the Lord,
    and shall I not avenge myself
    on a nation such as this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will take up weeping and wailing for the mountains,
    and a lamentation for the pastures of the wilderness,
because they are laid waste so that no one passes through,
    and the lowing of cattle is not heard;
both the birds of the air and the beasts
    have fled and are gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins,
    a lair of jackals,
and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation,
    without inhabitant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is the man so wise that he can understand this? To whom has the mouth of the Lord spoken, that he may declare it? Why is the land ruined and laid waste like a wilderness, so that no one passes through?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord says: “Because they have forsaken my law that I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice or walked in accord with it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but have stubbornly followed their own hearts and have gone after the Baals, as their fathers taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will feed this people with bitter food, and give them poisonous water to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter them among the nations whom neither they nor their fathers have known, and I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For a sound of wailing is heard from Zion:
    ‘How we are ruined!
    We are utterly shamed,
because we have left the land,
    because they have cast down our dwellings.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O women, the word of the Lord,
    and let your ear receive the word of his mouth;
teach to your daughters a lament,
    and each to her neighbor a dirge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For death has come up into our windows;
    it has entered our palaces,
cutting off the children from the streets
    and the young men from the squares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Speak: “Thus declares the Lord,
‘The dead bodies of men shall fall
    like dung upon the open field,
like sheaves after the reaper,
    and none shall gather them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Let not the wise man boast in his wisdom, let not the mighty man boast in his might, let not the rich man boast in his riches,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but let him who boasts boast in this, that he understands and knows me, that I am the Lord who practices steadfast love, justice, and righteousness in the earth. For in these things I delight, declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will punish all those who are circumcised merely in the flesh—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Egypt, Judah, Edom, the sons of Ammon, Moab, and all who dwell in the desert who cut the corners of their hair, for all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in heart.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word that the Lord speaks to you, O house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Learn not the way of the nations,
    nor be dismayed at the signs of the heavens
    because the nations are dismayed at them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the customs of the peoples are vanity.
A tree from the forest is cut down
    and worked with an axe by the hands of a craftsman.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their idols are like scarecrows in a cucumber field,
    and they cannot speak;
they have to be carried,
    for they cannot walk.
Do not be afraid of them,
    for they cannot do evil,
    neither is it in them to do good.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is none like you, O Lord;
    you are great, and your name is great in might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who would not fear you, O King of the nations?
    For this is your due;
for among all the wise ones of the nations
    and in all their kingdoms
    there is none like you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are both stupid and foolish;
    the instruction of idols is but wood!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is the true God;
    he is the living God and the everlasting King.
At his wrath the earth quakes,
    and the nations cannot endure his indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall you say to them: “The gods who did not make the heavens and the earth shall perish from the earth and from under the heavens.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is he who made the earth by his power,
    who established the world by his wisdom,
    and by his understanding stretched out the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he utters his voice, there is a tumult of waters in the heavens,
    and he makes the mist rise from the ends of the earth.
He makes lightning for the rain,
    and he brings forth the wind from his storehouses.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are worthless, a work of delusion;
    at the time of their punishment they shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Gather up your bundle from the ground,
    O you who dwell under siege!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord:
“Behold, I am slinging out the inhabitants of the land
    at this time,
and I will bring distress on them,
    that they may feel it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe is me because of my hurt!
    My wound is grievous.
But I said, “Truly this is an affliction,
    and I must bear it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the shepherds are stupid
    and do not inquire of the Lord;
therefore they have not prospered,
    and all their flock is scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice, a rumor! Behold, it comes!—
    a great commotion out of the north country
to make the cities of Judah a desolation,
    a lair of jackals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know, O Lord, that the way of man is not in himself,
    that it is not in man who walks to direct his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Correct me, O Lord, but in justice;
    not in your anger, lest you bring me to nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour out your wrath on the nations that know you not,
    and on the peoples that call not on your name,
for they have devoured Jacob;
    they have devoured him and consumed him,
    and have laid waste his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hear the words of this covenant, and speak to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say to them, Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man who does not hear the words of this covenant
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I commanded your fathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying, Listen to my voice, and do all that I command you. So shall you be my people, and I will be your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may confirm the oath that I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as at this day.” Then I answered, “So be it, Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem: Hear the words of this covenant and do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I solemnly warned your fathers when I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, warning them persistently, even to this day, saying, Obey my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not obey or incline their ear, but everyone walked in the stubbornness of his evil heart. Therefore I brought upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they did not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the Lord said to me, “A conspiracy exists among the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words. They have gone after other gods to serve them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant that I made with their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, thus says the Lord, Behold, I am bringing disaster upon them that they cannot escape. Though they cry to me, I will not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry to the gods to whom they make offerings, but they cannot save them in the time of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For your gods have become as many as your cities, O Judah, and as many as the streets of Jerusalem are the altars you have set up to shame, altars to make offerings to Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore do not pray for this people, or lift up a cry or prayer on their behalf, for I will not listen when they call to me in the time of their trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What right has my beloved in my house, when she has done many vile deeds? Can even sacrificial flesh avert your doom? Can you then exult?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord once called you ‘a green olive tree, beautiful with good fruit.’ But with the roar of a great tempest he will set fire to it, and its branches will be consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord of hosts, who planted you, has decreed disaster against you, because of the evil that the house of Israel and the house of Judah have done, provoking me to anger by making offerings to Baal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord made it known to me and I knew;
    then you showed me their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I was like a gentle lamb
    led to the slaughter.
I did not know it was against me
    they devised schemes, saying,
“Let us destroy the tree with its fruit,
    let us cut him off from the land of the living,
    that his name be remembered no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But, O Lord of hosts, who judges righteously,
    who tests the heart and the mind,
let me see your vengeance upon them,
    for to you have I committed my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord concerning the men of Anathoth, who seek your life, and say, “Do not prophesy in the name of the Lord, or you will die by our hand”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord of hosts: “Behold, I will punish them. The young men shall die by the sword, their sons and their daughters shall die by famine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and none of them shall be left. For I will bring disaster upon the men of Anathoth, the year of their punishment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous are you, O Lord,
    when I complain to you;
    yet I would plead my case before you.
Why does the way of the wicked prosper?
    Why do all who are treacherous thrive?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, know me;
    you see me, and test my heart toward you.
Pull them out like sheep for the slaughter,
    and set them apart for the day of slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will the land mourn
    and the grass of every field wither?
For the evil of those who dwell in it
    the beasts and the birds are swept away,
    because they said, “He will not see our latter end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If you have raced with men on foot, and they have wearied you,
    how will you compete with horses?
And if in a safe land you are so trusting,
    what will you do in the thicket of the Jordan?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Is my heritage to me like a hyena's lair?
    Are the birds of prey against her all around?
Go, assemble all the wild beasts;
    bring them to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They have made it a desolation;
    desolate, it mourns to me.
The whole land is made desolate,
    but no man lays it to heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon all the bare heights in the desert
    destroyers have come,
for the sword of the Lord devours
    from one end of the land to the other;
    no flesh has peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have sown wheat and have reaped thorns;
    they have tired themselves out but profit nothing.
They shall be ashamed of their harvests
    because of the fierce anger of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord concerning all my evil neighbors who touch the heritage that I have given my people Israel to inherit: “Behold, I will pluck them up from their land, and I will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after I have plucked them up, I will again have compassion on them, and I will bring them again each to his heritage and each to his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass, if they will diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, ‘As the Lord lives,’ even as they taught my people to swear by Baal, then they shall be built up in the midst of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if any nation will not listen, then I will utterly pluck it up and destroy it, declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord to me, “Go and buy a linen loincloth and put it around your waist, and do not dip it in water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought a loincloth according to the word of the Lord, and put it around my waist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me a second time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take the loincloth that you have bought, which is around your waist, and arise, go to the Euphrates and hide it there in a cleft of the rock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the Lord commanded me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after many days the Lord said to me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates, and take from there the loincloth that I commanded you to hide there.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I went to the Euphrates, and dug, and I took the loincloth from the place where I had hidden it. And behold, the loincloth was spoiled; it was good for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: Even so will I spoil the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This evil people, who refuse to hear my words, who stubbornly follow their own heart and have gone after other gods to serve them and worship them, shall be like this loincloth, which is good for nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the loincloth clings to the waist of a man, so I made the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah cling to me, declares the Lord, that they might be for me a people, a name, a praise, and a glory, but they would not listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall speak to them this word: ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, “Every jar shall be filled with wine.”’ And they will say to you, ‘Do we not indeed know that every jar will be filled with wine?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: Behold, I will fill with drunkenness all the inhabitants of this land: the kings who sit on David's throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will dash them one against another, fathers and sons together, declares the Lord. I will not pity or spare or have compassion, that I should not destroy them.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear and give ear; be not proud,
    for the Lord has spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give glory to the Lord your God
    before he brings darkness,
before your feet stumble
    on the twilight mountains,
and while you look for light
    he turns it into gloom
    and makes it deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if you will not listen,
    my soul will weep in secret for your pride;
my eyes will weep bitterly and run down with tears,
    because the Lord's flock has been taken captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to the king and the queen mother:
    “Take a lowly seat,
for your beautiful crown
    has come down from your head.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cities of the Negeb are shut up,
    with none to open them;
all Judah is taken into exile,
    wholly taken into exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Lift up your eyes and see
    those who come from the north.
Where is the flock that was given you,
    your beautiful flock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What will you say when they set as head over you
    those whom you yourself have taught to be friends to you?
Will not pangs take hold of you
    like those of a woman in labor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if you say in your heart,
    ‘Why have these things come upon me?’
it is for the greatness of your iniquity
    that your skirts are lifted up
    and you suffer violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can the Ethiopian change his skin
    or the leopard his spots?
Then also you can do good
    who are accustomed to do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will scatter you like chaff
    driven by the wind from the desert.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is your lot,
    the portion I have measured out to you, declares the Lord,
because you have forgotten me
    and trusted in lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I myself will lift up your skirts over your face,
    and your shame will be seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen your abominations,
    your adulteries and neighings, your lewd whorings,
    on the hills in the field.
Woe to you, O Jerusalem!
    How long will it be before you are made clean?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Judah mourns,
    and her gates languish;
her people lament on the ground,
    and the cry of Jerusalem goes up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because of the ground that is dismayed,
    since there is no rain on the land,
the farmers are ashamed;
    they cover their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the doe in the field forsakes her newborn fawn
    because there is no grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
O you hope of Israel,
    its savior in time of trouble,
why should you be like a stranger in the land,
    like a traveler who turns aside to tarry for a night?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should you be like a man confused,
    like a mighty warrior who cannot save?
Yet you, O Lord, are in the midst of us,
    and we are called by your name;
    do not leave us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me: “Do not pray for the welfare of this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though they fast, I will not hear their cry, and though they offer burnt offering and grain offering, I will not accept them. But I will consume them by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said: “Ah, Lord God, behold, the prophets say to them, ‘You shall not see the sword, nor shall you have famine, but I will give you assured peace in this place.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me: “The prophets are prophesying lies in my name. I did not send them, nor did I command them or speak to them. They are prophesying to you a lying vision, worthless divination, and the deceit of their own minds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name although I did not send them, and who say, ‘Sword and famine shall not come upon this land’: By sword and famine those prophets shall be consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people to whom they prophesy shall be cast out in the streets of Jerusalem, victims of famine and sword, with none to bury them—them, their wives, their sons, and their daughters. For I will pour out their evil upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall say to them this word:
‘Let my eyes run down with tears night and day,
    and let them not cease,
for the virgin daughter of my people is shattered with a great wound,
    with a very grievous blow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I go out into the field,
    behold, those pierced by the sword!
And if I enter the city,
    behold, the diseases of famine!
For both prophet and priest ply their trade through the land
    and have no knowledge.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you utterly rejected Judah?
    Does your soul loathe Zion?
Why have you struck us down
    so that there is no healing for us?
We looked for peace, but no good came;
    for a time of healing, but behold, terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We acknowledge our wickedness, O Lord,
    and the iniquity of our fathers,
    for we have sinned against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Are there any among the false gods of the nations that can bring rain?
    Or can the heavens give showers?
Are you not he, O Lord our God?
    We set our hope on you,
    for you do all these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my heart would not turn toward this people. Send them out of my sight, and let them go!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when they ask you, ‘Where shall we go?’ you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord:
“‘Those who are for pestilence, to pestilence,
    and those who are for the sword, to the sword;
those who are for famine, to famine,
    and those who are for captivity, to captivity.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will appoint over them four kinds of destroyers, declares the Lord: the sword to kill, the dogs to tear, and the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh the son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem,
    or who will grieve for you?
Who will turn aside
    to ask about your welfare?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have rejected me, declares the Lord;
    you keep going backward,
so I have stretched out my hand against you and destroyed you—
    I am weary of relenting.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Woe is me, my mother, that you bore me, a man of strife and contention to the whole land! I have not lent, nor have I borrowed, yet all of them curse me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said, “Have I not set you free for their good? Have I not pleaded for you before the enemy in the time of trouble and in the time of distress?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can one break iron, iron from the north, and bronze?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your wealth and your treasures I will give as spoil, without price, for all your sins, throughout all your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you serve your enemies in a land that you do not know, for in my anger a fire is kindled that shall burn forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Your words were found, and I ate them,
    and your words became to me a joy
    and the delight of my heart,
for I am called by your name,
    O Lord, God of hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I did not sit in the company of revelers,
    nor did I rejoice;
I sat alone, because your hand was upon me,
    for you had filled me with indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is my pain unceasing,
    my wound incurable,
    refusing to be healed?
Will you be to me like a deceitful brook,
    like waters that fail?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord:
“If you return, I will restore you,
    and you shall stand before me.
If you utter what is precious, and not what is worthless,
    you shall be as my mouth.
They shall turn to you,
    but you shall not turn to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will make you to this people
    a fortified wall of bronze;
they will fight against you,
    but they shall not prevail over you,
for I am with you
    to save you and deliver you,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will deliver you out of the hand of the wicked,
    and redeem you from the grasp of the ruthless.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not take a wife, nor shall you have sons or daughters in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord concerning the sons and daughters who are born in this place, and concerning the mothers who bore them and the fathers who fathered them in this land:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall die of deadly diseases. They shall not be lamented, nor shall they be buried. They shall be as dung on the surface of the ground. They shall perish by the sword and by famine, and their dead bodies shall be food for the birds of the air and for the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: Do not enter the house of mourning, or go to lament or grieve for them, for I have taken away my peace from this people, my steadfast love and mercy, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Both great and small shall die in this land. They shall not be buried, and no one shall lament for them or cut himself or make himself bald for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one shall break bread for the mourner, to comfort him for the dead, nor shall anyone give him the cup of consolation to drink for his father or his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will silence in this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And when you tell this people all these words, and they say to you, ‘Why has the Lord pronounced all this great evil against us? What is our iniquity? What is the sin that we have committed against the Lord our God?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then you shall say to them: ‘Because your fathers have forsaken me, declares the Lord, and have gone after other gods and have served and worshiped them, and have forsaken me and have not kept my law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because you have done worse than your fathers, for behold, every one of you follows his stubborn, evil will, refusing to listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will hurl you out of this land into a land that neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you shall serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when it shall no longer be said, ‘As the Lord lives who brought up the people of Israel out of the land of Egypt,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but ‘As the Lord lives who brought up the people of Israel out of the north country and out of all the countries where he had driven them.’ For I will bring them back to their own land that I gave to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I am sending for many fishers, declares the Lord, and they shall catch them. And afterward I will send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain and every hill, and out of the clefts of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my eyes are on all their ways. They are not hidden from me, nor is their iniquity concealed from my eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But first I will doubly repay their iniquity and their sin, because they have polluted my land with the carcasses of their detestable idols, and have filled my inheritance with their abominations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, my strength and my stronghold,
    my refuge in the day of trouble,
to you shall the nations come
    from the ends of the earth and say:
“Our fathers have inherited nothing but lies,
    worthless things in which there is no profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can man make for himself gods?
    Such are not gods!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, behold, I will make them know, this once I will make them know my power and my might, and they shall know that my name is the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The sin of Judah is written with a pen of iron; with a point of diamond it is engraved on the tablet of their heart, and on the horns of their altars,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while their children remember their altars and their Asherim, beside every green tree and on the high hills,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on the mountains in the open country. Your wealth and all your treasures I will give for spoil as the price of your high places for sin throughout all your territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall loosen your hand from your heritage that I gave to you, and I will make you serve your enemies in a land that you do not know, for in my anger a fire is kindled that shall burn forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Cursed is the man who trusts in man
    and makes flesh his strength,
    whose heart turns away from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is like a shrub in the desert,
    and shall not see any good come.
He shall dwell in the parched places of the wilderness,
    in an uninhabited salt land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blessed is the man who trusts in the Lord,
    whose trust is the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is like a tree planted by water,
    that sends out its roots by the stream,
and does not fear when heat comes,
    for its leaves remain green,
and is not anxious in the year of drought,
    for it does not cease to bear fruit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I the Lord search the heart
    and test the mind,
to give every man according to his ways,
    according to the fruit of his deeds.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the partridge that gathers a brood that she did not hatch,
    so is he who gets riches but not by justice;
in the midst of his days they will leave him,
    and at his end he will be a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A glorious throne set on high from the beginning
    is the place of our sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, the hope of Israel,
    all who forsake you shall be put to shame;
those who turn away from you shall be written in the earth,
    for they have forsaken the Lord, the fountain of living water.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, they say to me,
    “Where is the word of the Lord?
    Let it come!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not run away from being your shepherd,
    nor have I desired the day of sickness.
You know what came out of my lips;
    it was before your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be not a terror to me;
    you are my refuge in the day of disaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Thus said the Lord to me: “Go and stand in the People's Gate, by which the kings of Judah enter and by which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say: ‘Hear the word of the Lord, you kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, who enter by these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: Take care for the sake of your lives, and do not bear a burden on the Sabbath day or bring it in by the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And do not carry a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath or do any work, but keep the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they did not listen or incline their ear, but stiffened their neck, that they might not hear and receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘But if you listen to me, declares the Lord, and bring in no burden by the gates of this city on the Sabbath day, but keep the Sabbath day holy and do no work on it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then there shall enter by the gates of this city kings and princes who sit on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their officials, the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem. And this city shall be inhabited forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And people shall come from the cities of Judah and the places around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, from the Shephelah, from the hill country, and from the Negeb, bringing burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings and frankincense, and bringing thank offerings to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not listen to me, to keep the Sabbath day holy, and not to bear a burden and enter by the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem and shall not be quenched.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Arise, and go down to the potter's house, and there I will let you hear my words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went down to the potter's house, and there he was working at his wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the vessel he was making of clay was spoiled in the potter's hand, and he reworked it into another vessel, as it seemed good to the potter to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O house of Israel, can I not do with you as this potter has done? declares the Lord. Behold, like the clay in the potter's hand, so are you in my hand, O house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If at any time I declare concerning a nation or a kingdom, that I will pluck up and break down and destroy it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if that nation, concerning which I have spoken, turns from its evil, I will relent of the disaster that I intended to do to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if at any time I declare concerning a nation or a kingdom that I will build and plant it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if it does evil in my sight, not listening to my voice, then I will relent of the good that I had intended to do to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, therefore, say to the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: ‘Thus says the Lord, Behold, I am shaping disaster against you and devising a plan against you. Return, every one from his evil way, and amend your ways and your deeds.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But they say, ‘That is in vain! We will follow our own plans, and will every one act according to the stubbornness of his evil heart.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore thus says the Lord:
Ask among the nations,
    Who has heard the like of this?
The virgin Israel
    has done a very horrible thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does the snow of Lebanon leave
    the crags of Sirion?
Do the mountain waters run dry,
    the cold flowing streams?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
making their land a horror,
    a thing to be hissed at forever.
Everyone who passes by it is horrified
    and shakes his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the east wind I will scatter them
    before the enemy.
I will show them my back, not my face,
    in the day of their calamity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said, “Come, let us make plots against Jeremiah, for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, let us strike him with the tongue, and let us not pay attention to any of his words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me, O Lord,
    and listen to the voice of my adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should good be repaid with evil?
    Yet they have dug a pit for my life.
Remember how I stood before you
    to speak good for them,
    to turn away your wrath from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
May a cry be heard from their houses,
    when you bring the plunderer suddenly upon them!
For they have dug a pit to take me
    and laid snares for my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet you, O Lord, know
    all their plotting to kill me.
Forgive not their iniquity,
    nor blot out their sin from your sight.
Let them be overthrown before you;
    deal with them in the time of your anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, “Go, buy a potter's earthenware flask, and take some of the elders of the people and some of the elders of the priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and go out to the Valley of the Son of Hinnom at the entry of the Potsherd Gate, and proclaim there the words that I tell you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, O kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem. Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am bringing such disaster upon this place that the ears of everyone who hears of it will tingle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the people have forsaken me and have profaned this place by making offerings in it to other gods whom neither they nor their fathers nor the kings of Judah have known; and because they have filled this place with the blood of innocents,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have built the high places of Baal to burn their sons in the fire as burnt offerings to Baal, which I did not command or decree, nor did it come into my mind—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, days are coming, declares the Lord, when this place shall no more be called Topheth, or the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this place I will make void the plans of Judah and Jerusalem, and will cause their people to fall by the sword before their enemies, and by the hand of those who seek their life. I will give their dead bodies for food to the birds of the air and to the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make this city a horror, a thing to be hissed at. Everyone who passes by it will be horrified and will hiss because of all its wounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and their daughters, and everyone shall eat the flesh of his neighbor in the siege and in the distress, with which their enemies and those who seek their life afflict them.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall break the flask in the sight of the men who go with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: So will I break this people and this city, as one breaks a potter's vessel, so that it can never be mended. Men shall bury in Topheth because there will be no place else to bury.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus will I do to this place, declares the Lord, and to its inhabitants, making this city like Topheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah—all the houses on whose roofs offerings have been offered to all the host of heaven, and drink offerings have been poured out to other gods—shall be defiled like the place of Topheth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah came from Topheth, where the Lord had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the court of the Lord's house and said to all the people:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, behold, I am bringing upon this city and upon all its towns all the disaster that I have pronounced against it, because they have stiffened their neck, refusing to hear my words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Pashhur the priest, the son of Immer, who was chief officer in the house of the Lord, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pashhur beat Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the upper Benjamin Gate of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when Pashhur released Jeremiah from the stocks, Jeremiah said to him, “The Lord does not call your name Pashhur, but Terror on Every Side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord: Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They shall fall by the sword of their enemies while you look on. And I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon. He shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall strike them down with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will give all the wealth of the city, all its gains, all its prized belongings, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah into the hand of their enemies, who shall plunder them and seize them and carry them to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, Pashhur, and all who dwell in your house, shall go into captivity. To Babylon you shall go, and there you shall die, and there you shall be buried, you and all your friends, to whom you have prophesied falsely.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For whenever I speak, I cry out,
    I shout, “Violence and destruction!”
For the word of the Lord has become for me
    a reproach and derision all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, “I will not mention him,
    or speak any more in his name,”
there is in my heart as it were a burning fire
    shut up in my bones,
and I am weary with holding it in,
    and I cannot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I hear many whispering.
    Terror is on every side!
“Denounce him! Let us denounce him!”
    say all my close friends,
    watching for my fall.
