“Perhaps he will be deceived;
    then we can overcome him
    and take our revenge on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the Lord is with me as a dread warrior;
    therefore my persecutors will stumble;
    they will not overcome me.
They will be greatly shamed,
    for they will not succeed.
Their eternal dishonor
    will never be forgotten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord of hosts, who tests the righteous,
    who sees the heart and the mind,
let me see your vengeance upon them,
    for to you have I committed my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord;
    praise the Lord!
For he has delivered the life of the needy
    from the hand of evildoers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be the day
    on which I was born!
The day when my mother bore me,
    let it not be blessed!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cursed be the man who brought the news to my father,
“A son is born to you,”
    making him very glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let that man be like the cities
    that the Lord overthrew without pity;
let him hear a cry in the morning
    and an alarm at noon,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why did I come out from the womb
    to see toil and sorrow,
    and spend my days in shame?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur the son of Malchiah and Zephaniah the priest, the son of Maaseiah, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Inquire of the Lord for us, for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is making war against us. Perhaps the Lord will deal with us according to all his wonderful deeds and will make him withdraw from us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah said to them: “Thus you shall say to Zedekiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Behold, I will turn back the weapons of war that are in your hands and with which you are fighting against the king of Babylon and against the Chaldeans who are besieging you outside the walls. And I will bring them together into the midst of this city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will fight against you with outstretched hand and strong arm, in anger and in fury and in great wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will strike down the inhabitants of this city, both man and beast. They shall die of a great pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward, declares the Lord, I will give Zedekiah king of Judah and his servants and the people in this city who survive the pestilence, sword, and famine into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and into the hand of their enemies, into the hand of those who seek their lives. He shall strike them down with the edge of the sword. He shall not pity them or spare them or have compassion.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And to this people you shall say: ‘Thus says the Lord: Behold, I set before you the way of life and the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who stays in this city shall die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence, but he who goes out and surrenders to the Chaldeans who are besieging you shall live and shall have his life as a prize of war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have set my face against this city for harm and not for good, declares the Lord: it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And to the house of the king of Judah say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O house of David! Thus says the Lord:
“‘Execute justice in the morning,
    and deliver from the hand of the oppressor
    him who has been robbed,
lest my wrath go forth like fire,
    and burn with none to quench it,
    because of your evil deeds.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Behold, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley,
    O rock of the plain,
declares the Lord;
you who say, ‘Who shall come down against us,
    or who shall enter our habitations?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will punish you according to the fruit of your deeds,
declares the Lord;
    I will kindle a fire in her forest,
    and it shall devour all that is around her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Go down to the house of the king of Judah and speak there this word,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Hear the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, who sits on the throne of David, you, and your servants, and your people who enter these gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: Do justice and righteousness, and deliver from the hand of the oppressor him who has been robbed. And do no wrong or violence to the resident alien, the fatherless, and the widow, nor shed innocent blood in this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you will indeed obey this word, then there shall enter the gates of this house kings who sit on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they and their servants and their people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you will not obey these words, I swear by myself, declares the Lord, that this house shall become a desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord concerning the house of the king of Judah:
“‘You are like Gilead to me,
    like the summit of Lebanon,
yet surely I will make you a desert,
    an uninhabited city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will prepare destroyers against you,
    each with his weapons,
and they shall cut down your choicest cedars
    and cast them into the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘And many nations will pass by this city, and every man will say to his neighbor, “Why has the Lord dealt thus with this great city?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will answer, “Because they have forsaken the covenant of the Lord their God and worshiped other gods and served them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Weep not for him who is dead,
    nor grieve for him,
but weep bitterly for him who goes away,
    for he shall return no more
    to see his native land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord concerning Shallum the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who reigned instead of Josiah his father, and who went away from this place: “He shall return here no more,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in the place where they have carried him captive, there shall he die, and he shall never see this land again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness,
    and his upper rooms by injustice,
who makes his neighbor serve him for nothing
    and does not give him his wages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who says, ‘I will build myself a great house
    with spacious upper rooms,’
who cuts out windows for it,
    paneling it with cedar
    and painting it with vermilion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you think you are a king
    because you compete in cedar?
Did not your father eat and drink
    and do justice and righteousness?
    Then it was well with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He judged the cause of the poor and needy;
    then it was well.
Is not this to know me?
    declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you have eyes and heart
    only for your dishonest gain,
for shedding innocent blood,
    and for practicing oppression and violence.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord concerning Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
“They shall not lament for him, saying,
    ‘Ah, my brother!’ or ‘Ah, sister!’
They shall not lament for him, saying,
    ‘Ah, lord!’ or ‘Ah, his majesty!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With the burial of a donkey he shall be buried,
    dragged and dumped beyond the gates of Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Go up to Lebanon, and cry out,
    and lift up your voice in Bashan;
cry out from Abarim,
    for all your lovers are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I spoke to you in your prosperity,
    but you said, ‘I will not listen.’
This has been your way from your youth,
    that you have not obeyed my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wind shall shepherd all your shepherds,
    and your lovers shall go into captivity;
then you will be ashamed and confounded
    because of all your evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O inhabitant of Lebanon,
    nested among the cedars,
how you will be pitied when pangs come upon you,
    pain as of a woman in labor!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live, declares the Lord, though Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, were the signet ring on my right hand, yet I would tear you off
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and give you into the hand of those who seek your life, into the hand of those of whom you are afraid, even into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and into the hand of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hurl you and the mother who bore you into another country, where you were not born, and there you shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the land to which they will long to return, there they shall not return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is this man Coniah a despised, broken pot,
    a vessel no one cares for?
Why are he and his children hurled and cast
    into a land that they do not know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O land, land, land,
    hear the word of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Write this man down as childless,
    a man who shall not succeed in his days,
for none of his offspring shall succeed
    in sitting on the throne of David
    and ruling again in Judah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture!” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning the shepherds who care for my people: “You have scattered my flock and have driven them away, and you have not attended to them. Behold, I will attend to you for your evil deeds, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries where I have driven them, and I will bring them back to their fold, and they shall be fruitful and multiply.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set shepherds over them who will care for them, and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall any be missing, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will raise up for David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal wisely, and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his days Judah will be saved, and Israel will dwell securely. And this is the name by which he will be called: ‘The Lord is our righteousness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when they shall no longer say, ‘As the Lord lives who brought up the people of Israel out of the land of Egypt,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but ‘As the Lord lives who brought up and led the offspring of the house of Israel out of the north country and out of all the countries where he had driven them.’ Then they shall dwell in their own land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Concerning the prophets:
My heart is broken within me;
    all my bones shake;
I am like a drunken man,
    like a man overcome by wine,
because of the Lord
    and because of his holy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the land is full of adulterers;
    because of the curse the land mourns,
    and the pastures of the wilderness are dried up.
Their course is evil,
    and their might is not right.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore their way shall be to them
    like slippery paths in the darkness,
    into which they shall be driven and fall,
for I will bring disaster upon them
    in the year of their punishment,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the prophets of Samaria
    I saw an unsavory thing:
they prophesied by Baal
    and led my people Israel astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But in the prophets of Jerusalem
    I have seen a horrible thing:
they commit adultery and walk in lies;
    they strengthen the hands of evildoers,
    so that no one turns from his evil;
all of them have become like Sodom to me,
    and its inhabitants like Gomorrah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts concerning the prophets:
“Behold, I will feed them with bitter food
    and give them poisoned water to drink,
for from the prophets of Jerusalem
    ungodliness has gone out into all the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts: “Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you, filling you with vain hopes. They speak visions of their own minds, not from the mouth of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They say continually to those who despise the word of the Lord, ‘It shall be well with you’; and to everyone who stubbornly follows his own heart, they say, ‘No disaster shall come upon you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For who among them has stood in the council of the Lord
    to see and to hear his word,
    or who has paid attention to his word and listened?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the storm of the Lord!
    Wrath has gone forth,
a whirling tempest;
    it will burst upon the head of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The anger of the Lord will not turn back
    until he has executed and accomplished
    the intents of his heart.
In the latter days you will understand it clearly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I did not send the prophets,
    yet they ran;
I did not speak to them,
    yet they prophesied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they had stood in my council,
    then they would have proclaimed my words to my people,
and they would have turned them from their evil way,
    and from the evil of their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Am I a God at hand, declares the Lord, and not a God far away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can a man hide himself in secret places so that I cannot see him? declares the Lord. Do I not fill heaven and earth? declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard what the prophets have said who prophesy lies in my name, saying, ‘I have dreamed, I have dreamed!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long shall there be lies in the heart of the prophets who prophesy lies, and who prophesy the deceit of their own heart,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who think to make my people forget my name by their dreams that they tell one another, even as their fathers forgot my name for Baal?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the prophet who has a dream tell the dream, but let him who has my word speak my word faithfully. What has straw in common with wheat? declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not my word like fire, declares the Lord, and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, declares the Lord, who steal my words from one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against the prophets, declares the Lord, who use their tongues and declare, ‘declares the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams, declares the Lord, and who tell them and lead my people astray by their lies and their recklessness, when I did not send them or charge them. So they do not profit this people at all, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When one of this people, or a prophet or a priest asks you, ‘What is the burden of the Lord?’ you shall say to them, ‘You are the burden, and I will cast you off, declares the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the prophet, priest, or one of the people who says, ‘The burden of the Lord,’ I will punish that man and his household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall you say, every one to his neighbor and every one to his brother, ‘What has the Lord answered?’ or ‘What has the Lord spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ‘the burden of the Lord’ you shall mention no more, for the burden is every man's own word, and you pervert the words of the living God, the Lord of hosts, our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you shall say to the prophet, ‘What has the Lord answered you?’ or ‘What has the Lord spoken?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you say, ‘The burden of the Lord,’ thus says the Lord, ‘Because you have said these words, “The burden of the Lord,” when I sent to you, saying, “You shall not say, ‘The burden of the Lord,’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I will surely lift you up and cast you away from my presence, you and the city that I gave to you and your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring upon you everlasting reproach and perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had taken into exile from Jerusalem Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, together with the officials of Judah, the craftsmen, and the metal workers, and had brought them to Babylon, the Lord showed me this vision: behold, two baskets of figs placed before the temple of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One basket had very good figs, like first-ripe figs, but the other basket had very bad figs, so bad that they could not be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “What do you see, Jeremiah?” I said, “Figs, the good figs very good, and the bad figs very bad, so bad that they cannot be eaten.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Like these good figs, so I will regard as good the exiles from Judah, whom I have sent away from this place to the land of the Chaldeans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set my eyes on them for good, and I will bring them back to this land. I will build them up, and not tear them down; I will plant them, and not pluck them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them a heart to know that I am the Lord, and they shall be my people and I will be their God, for they shall return to me with their whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But thus says the Lord: Like the bad figs that are so bad they cannot be eaten, so will I treat Zedekiah the king of Judah, his officials, the remnant of Jerusalem who remain in this land, and those who dwell in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, to be a reproach, a byword, a taunt, and a curse in all the places where I shall drive them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will send sword, famine, and pestilence upon them, until they shall be utterly destroyed from the land that I gave to them and their fathers.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah (that was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For twenty-three years, from the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon, king of Judah, to this day, the word of the Lord has come to me, and I have spoken persistently to you, but you have not listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have neither listened nor inclined your ears to hear, although the Lord persistently sent to you all his servants the prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘Turn now, every one of you, from his evil way and evil deeds, and dwell upon the land that the Lord has given to you and your fathers from of old and forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go after other gods to serve and worship them, or provoke me to anger with the work of your hands. Then I will do you no harm.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have not listened to me, declares the Lord, that you might provoke me to anger with the work of your hands to your own harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord of hosts: Because you have not obeyed my words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, I will send for all the tribes of the north, declares the Lord, and for Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and I will bring them against this land and its inhabitants, and against all these surrounding nations. I will devote them to destruction, and make them a horror, a hissing, and an everlasting desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will banish from them the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the grinding of the millstones and the light of the lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This whole land shall become a ruin and a waste, and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after seventy years are completed, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, the land of the Chaldeans, for their iniquity, declares the Lord, making the land an everlasting waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring upon that land all the words that I have uttered against it, everything written in this book, which Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For many nations and great kings shall make slaves even of them, and I will recompense them according to their deeds and the work of their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Lord, the God of Israel, said to me: “Take from my hand this cup of the wine of wrath, and make all the nations to whom I send you drink it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall drink and stagger and be crazed because of the sword that I am sending among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the cup from the Lord's hand, and made all the nations to whom the Lord sent me drink it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, its kings and officials, to make them a desolation and a waste, a hissing and a curse, as at this day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his officials, all his people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the mixed tribes among them; all the kings of the land of Uz and all the kings of the land of the Philistines (Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Edom, Moab, and the sons of Ammon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the coastland across the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who cut the corners of their hair;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed tribes who dwell in the desert;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of Media;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: all the kings of the north, far and near, one after another, and all the kingdoms of the world that are on the face of the earth. And after them the king of Babylon shall drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Drink, be drunk and vomit, fall and rise no more, because of the sword that I am sending among you.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And if they refuse to accept the cup from your hand to drink, then you shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts: You must drink!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I begin to work disaster at the city that is called by my name, and shall you go unpunished? You shall not go unpunished, for I am summoning a sword against all the inhabitants of the earth, declares the Lord of hosts.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You, therefore, shall prophesy against them all these words, and say to them:
“‘The Lord will roar from on high,
    and from his holy habitation utter his voice;
he will roar mightily against his fold,
    and shout, like those who tread grapes,
    against all the inhabitants of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The clamor will resound to the ends of the earth,
    for the Lord has an indictment against the nations;
he is entering into judgment with all flesh,
    and the wicked he will put to the sword,
declares the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord of hosts:
Behold, disaster is going forth
    from nation to nation,
and a great tempest is stirring
    from the farthest parts of the earth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And those pierced by the Lord on that day shall extend from one end of the earth to the other. They shall not be lamented, or gathered, or buried; they shall be dung on the surface of the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Wail, you shepherds, and cry out,
    and roll in ashes, you lords of the flock,
for the days of your slaughter and dispersion have come,
    and you shall fall like a choice vessel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No refuge will remain for the shepherds,
    nor escape for the lords of the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice—the cry of the shepherds,
    and the wail of the lords of the flock!
For the Lord is laying waste their pasture,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the peaceful folds are devastated
    because of the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a lion he has left his lair,
    for their land has become a waste
because of the sword of the oppressor,
    and because of his fierce anger.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: Stand in the court of the Lord's house, and speak to all the cities of Judah that come to worship in the house of the Lord all the words that I command you to speak to them; do not hold back a word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It may be they will listen, and every one turn from his evil way, that I may relent of the disaster that I intend to do to them because of their evil deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord: If you will not listen to me, to walk in my law that I have set before you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to listen to the words of my servants the prophets whom I send to you urgently, though you have not listened,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make this house like Shiloh, and I will make this city a curse for all the nations of the earth.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests and the prophets and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Jeremiah had finished speaking all that the Lord had commanded him to speak to all the people, then the priests and the prophets and all the people laid hold of him, saying, “You shall die!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why have you prophesied in the name of the Lord, saying, ‘This house shall be like Shiloh, and this city shall be desolate, without inhabitant’?” And all the people gathered around Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the officials of Judah heard these things, they came up from the king's house to the house of the Lord and took their seat in the entry of the New Gate of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priests and the prophets said to the officials and to all the people, “This man deserves the sentence of death, because he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your own ears.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah spoke to all the officials and all the people, saying, “The Lord sent me to prophesy against this house and this city all the words you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore mend your ways and your deeds, and obey the voice of the Lord your God, and the Lord will relent of the disaster that he has pronounced against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for me, behold, I am in your hands. Do with me as seems good and right to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only know for certain that if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood upon yourselves and upon this city and its inhabitants, for in truth the Lord sent me to you to speak all these words in your ears.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officials and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, “This man does not deserve the sentence of death, for he has spoken to us in the name of the Lord our God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And certain of the elders of the land arose and spoke to all the assembled people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Micah of Moresheth prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and said to all the people of Judah: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts,
“‘Zion shall be plowed as a field;
    Jerusalem shall become a heap of ruins,
    and the mountain of the house a wooded height.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Did he not fear the Lord and entreat the favor of the Lord, and did not the Lord relent of the disaster that he had pronounced against them? But we are about to bring great disaster upon ourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was another man who prophesied in the name of the Lord, Uriah the son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim. He prophesied against this city and against this land in words like those of Jeremiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when King Jehoiakim, with all his warriors and all the officials, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death. But when Uriah heard of it, he was afraid and fled and escaped to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Jehoiakim sent to Egypt certain men, Elnathan the son of Achbor and others with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they took Uriah from Egypt and brought him to King Jehoiakim, who struck him down with the sword and dumped his dead body into the burial place of the common people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah so that he was not given over to the people to be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Lord said to me: “Make yourself straps and yoke-bars, and put them on your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send word to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the sons of Ammon, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon by the hand of the envoys who have come to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Give them this charge for their masters: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: This is what you shall say to your masters:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It is I who by my great power and my outstretched arm have made the earth, with the men and animals that are on the earth, and I give it to whomever it seems right to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have given all these lands into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, my servant, and I have given him also the beasts of the field to serve him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the nations shall serve him and his son and his grandson, until the time of his own land comes. Then many nations and great kings shall make him their slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “‘“But if any nation or kingdom will not serve this Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, I will punish that nation with the sword, with famine, and with pestilence, declares the Lord, until I have consumed it by his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not listen to your prophets, your diviners, your dreamers, your fortune-tellers, or your sorcerers, who are saying to you, ‘You shall not serve the king of Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is a lie that they are prophesying to you, with the result that you will be removed far from your land, and I will drive you out, and you will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But any nation that will bring its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will leave on its own land, to work it and dwell there, declares the Lord.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Zedekiah king of Judah I spoke in like manner: “Bring your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon, and serve him and his people and live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why will you and your people die by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence, as the Lord has spoken concerning any nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who are saying to you, ‘You shall not serve the king of Babylon,’ for it is a lie that they are prophesying to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not sent them, declares the Lord, but they are prophesying falsely in my name, with the result that I will drive you out and you will perish, you and the prophets who are prophesying to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, “Thus says the Lord: Do not listen to the words of your prophets who are prophesying to you, saying, ‘Behold, the vessels of the Lord's house will now shortly be brought back from Babylon,’ for it is a lie that they are prophesying to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not listen to them; serve the king of Babylon and live. Why should this city become a desolation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they are prophets, and if the word of the Lord is with them, then let them intercede with the Lord of hosts, that the vessels that are left in the house of the Lord, in the house of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem may not go to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts concerning the pillars, the sea, the stands, and the rest of the vessels that are left in this city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take away, when he took into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that are left in the house of the Lord, in the house of the king of Judah, and in Jerusalem:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be carried to Babylon and remain there until the day when I visit them, declares the Lord. Then I will bring them back and restore them to this place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same year, at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the fifth month of the fourth year, Hananiah the son of Azzur, the prophet from Gibeon, spoke to me in the house of the Lord, in the presence of the priests and all the people, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Within two years I will bring back to this place all the vessels of the Lord's house, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place and carried to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also bring back to this place Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and all the exiles from Judah who went to Babylon, declares the Lord, for I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Jeremiah spoke to Hananiah the prophet in the presence of the priests and all the people who were standing in the house of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the prophet Jeremiah said, “Amen! May the Lord do so; may the Lord make the words that you have prophesied come true, and bring back to this place from Babylon the vessels of the house of the Lord, and all the exiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet hear now this word that I speak in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prophets who preceded you and me from ancient times prophesied war, famine, and pestilence against many countries and great kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prophet who prophesies peace, when the word of that prophet comes to pass, then it will be known that the Lord has truly sent the prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the prophet Hananiah took the yoke-bars from the neck of Jeremiah the prophet and broke them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hananiah spoke in the presence of all the people, saying, “Thus says the Lord: Even so will I break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all the nations within two years.” But Jeremiah the prophet went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sometime after the prophet Hananiah had broken the yoke-bars from off the neck of Jeremiah the prophet, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, tell Hananiah, ‘Thus says the Lord: You have broken wooden bars, but you have made in their place bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: I have put upon the neck of all these nations an iron yoke to serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and they shall serve him, for I have given to him even the beasts of the field.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jeremiah the prophet said to the prophet Hananiah, “Listen, Hananiah, the Lord has not sent you, and you have made this people trust in a lie.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord: ‘Behold, I will remove you from the face of the earth. This year you shall die, because you have uttered rebellion against the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that same year, in the seventh month, the prophet Hananiah died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the surviving elders of the exiles, and to the priests, the prophets, and all the people, whom Nebuchadnezzar had taken into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was after King Jeconiah and the queen mother, the eunuchs, the officials of Judah and Jerusalem, the craftsmen, and the metal workers had departed from Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The letter was sent by the hand of Elasah the son of Shaphan and Gemariah the son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. It said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, to all the exiles whom I have sent into exile from Jerusalem to Babylon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build houses and live in them; plant gardens and eat their produce.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take wives and have sons and daughters; take wives for your sons, and give your daughters in marriage, that they may bear sons and daughters; multiply there, and do not decrease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But seek the welfare of the city where I have sent you into exile, and pray to the Lord on its behalf, for in its welfare you will find your welfare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Do not let your prophets and your diviners who are among you deceive you, and do not listen to the dreams that they dream,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it is a lie that they are prophesying to you in my name; I did not send them, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: When seventy years are completed for Babylon, I will visit you, and I will fulfill to you my promise and bring you back to this place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will call upon me and come and pray to me, and I will hear you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will seek me and find me, when you seek me with all your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be found by you, declares the Lord, and I will restore your fortunes and gather you from all the nations and all the places where I have driven you, declares the Lord, and I will bring you back to the place from which I sent you into exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Because you have said, ‘The Lord has raised up prophets for us in Babylon,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord concerning the king who sits on the throne of David, and concerning all the people who dwell in this city, your kinsmen who did not go out with you into exile:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, behold, I am sending on them sword, famine, and pestilence, and I will make them like vile figs that are so rotten they cannot be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pursue them with sword, famine, and pestilence, and will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, to be a curse, a terror, a hissing, and a reproach among all the nations where I have driven them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they did not pay attention to my words, declares the Lord, that I persistently sent to you by my servants the prophets, but you would not listen, declares the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hear the word of the Lord, all you exiles whom I sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who are prophesying a lie to you in my name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall strike them down before your eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of them this curse shall be used by all the exiles from Judah in Babylon: “The Lord make you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they have done an outrageous thing in Israel, they have committed adultery with their neighbors' wives, and they have spoken in my name lying words that I did not command them. I am the one who knows, and I am witness, declares the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Shemaiah of Nehelam you shall say:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: You have sent letters in your name to all the people who are in Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Lord has made you priest instead of Jehoiada the priest, to have charge in the house of the Lord over every madman who prophesies, to put him in the stocks and neck irons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth who is prophesying to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he has sent to us in Babylon, saying, “Your exile will be long; build houses and live in them, and plant gardens and eat their produce.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the hearing of Jeremiah the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Send to all the exiles, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord concerning Shemaiah of Nehelam: Because Shemaiah had prophesied to you when I did not send him, and has made you trust in a lie,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord: Behold, I will punish Shemaiah of Nehelam and his descendants. He shall not have anyone living among this people, and he shall not see the good that I will do to my people, declares the Lord, for he has spoken rebellion against the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Write in a book all the words that I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will restore the fortunes of my people, Israel and Judah, says the Lord, and I will bring them back to the land that I gave to their fathers, and they shall take possession of it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the words that the Lord spoke concerning Israel and Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord:
We have heard a cry of panic,
    of terror, and no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ask now, and see,
    can a man bear a child?
Why then do I see every man
    with his hands on his stomach like a woman in labor?
    Why has every face turned pale?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “And it shall come to pass in that day, declares the Lord of hosts, that I will break his yoke from off your neck, and I will burst your bonds, and foreigners shall no more make a servant of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shall serve the Lord their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I am with you to save you,
declares the Lord;
I will make a full end of all the nations
    among whom I scattered you,
    but of you I will not make a full end.
I will discipline you in just measure,
    and I will by no means leave you unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For thus says the Lord:
Your hurt is incurable,
    and your wound is grievous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is none to uphold your cause,
    no medicine for your wound,
    no healing for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you cry out over your hurt?
    Your pain is incurable.
Because your guilt is great,
    because your sins are flagrant,
    I have done these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore all who devour you shall be devoured,
    and all your foes, every one of them, shall go into captivity;
those who plunder you shall be plundered,
    and all who prey on you I will make a prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will restore health to you,
    and your wounds I will heal,
declares the Lord,
because they have called you an outcast:
    ‘It is Zion, for whom no one cares!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord:
Behold, I will restore the fortunes of the tents of Jacob
    and have compassion on his dwellings;
the city shall be rebuilt on its mound,
    and the palace shall stand where it used to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of them shall come songs of thanksgiving,
    and the voices of those who celebrate.
I will multiply them, and they shall not be few;
    I will make them honored, and they shall not be small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their children shall be as they were of old,
    and their congregation shall be established before me,
    and I will punish all who oppress them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And you shall be my people,
    and I will be your God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold the storm of the Lord!
    Wrath has gone forth,
a whirling tempest;
    it will burst upon the head of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fierce anger of the Lord will not turn back
    until he has executed and accomplished
    the intentions of his mind.
In the latter days you will understand this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At that time, declares the Lord, I will be the God of all the clans of Israel, and they shall be my people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“The people who survived the sword
    found grace in the wilderness;
when Israel sought for rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Again I will build you, and you shall be built,
    O virgin Israel!
Again you shall adorn yourself with tambourines
    and shall go forth in the dance of the merrymakers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Again you shall plant vineyards
    on the mountains of Samaria;
the planters shall plant
    and shall enjoy the fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there shall be a day when watchmen will call
    in the hill country of Ephraim:
‘Arise, and let us go up to Zion,
    to the Lord our God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thus says the Lord:
“Sing aloud with gladness for Jacob,
    and raise shouts for the chief of the nations;
proclaim, give praise, and say,
    ‘O Lord, save your people,
    the remnant of Israel.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will bring them from the north country
    and gather them from the farthest parts of the earth,
among them the blind and the lame,
    the pregnant woman and she who is in labor, together;
    a great company, they shall return here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With weeping they shall come,
    and with pleas for mercy I will lead them back,
I will make them walk by brooks of water,
    in a straight path in which they shall not stumble,
for I am a father to Israel,
    and Ephraim is my firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear the word of the Lord, O nations,
    and declare it in the coastlands far away;
say, ‘He who scattered Israel will gather him,
    and will keep him as a shepherd keeps his flock.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord has ransomed Jacob
    and has redeemed him from hands too strong for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall come and sing aloud on the height of Zion,
    and they shall be radiant over the goodness of the Lord,
over the grain, the wine, and the oil,
    and over the young of the flock and the herd;
their life shall be like a watered garden,
    and they shall languish no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then shall the young women rejoice in the dance,
    and the young men and the old shall be merry.
I will turn their mourning into joy;
    I will comfort them, and give them gladness for sorrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will feast the soul of the priests with abundance,
    and my people shall be satisfied with my goodness,
declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“A voice is heard in Ramah,
    lamentation and bitter weeping.
Rachel is weeping for her children;
    she refuses to be comforted for her children,
    because they are no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“Keep your voice from weeping,
    and your eyes from tears,
for there is a reward for your work,
declares the Lord,
    and they shall come back from the land of the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is hope for your future,
declares the Lord,
    and your children shall come back to their own country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard Ephraim grieving,
‘You have disciplined me, and I was disciplined,
    like an untrained calf;
bring me back that I may be restored,
    for you are the Lord my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For after I had turned away, I relented,
    and after I was instructed, I struck my thigh;
I was ashamed, and I was confounded,
    because I bore the disgrace of my youth.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is Ephraim my dear son?
    Is he my darling child?
For as often as I speak against him,
    I do remember him still.
Therefore my heart yearns for him;
    I will surely have mercy on him,
declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you waver,
    O faithless daughter?
For the Lord has created a new thing on the earth:
    a woman encircles a man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: “Once more they shall use these words in the land of Judah and in its cities, when I restore their fortunes:
“‘The Lord bless you, O habitation of righteousness,
    O holy hill!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Judah and all its cities shall dwell there together, and the farmers and those who wander with their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will satisfy the weary soul, and every languishing soul I will replenish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this I awoke and looked, and my sleep was pleasant to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of man and the seed of beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that as I have watched over them to pluck up and break down, to overthrow, destroy, and bring harm, so I will watch over them to build and to plant, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In those days they shall no longer say:
“‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes,
    and the children's teeth are set on edge.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But everyone shall die for his own iniquity. Each man who eats sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and the house of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not like the covenant that I made with their fathers on the day when I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of Egypt, my covenant that they broke, though I was their husband, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, declares the Lord: I will put my law within them, and I will write it on their hearts. And I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no longer shall each one teach his neighbor and each his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’ for they shall all know me, from the least of them to the greatest, declares the Lord. For I will forgive their iniquity, and I will remember their sin no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord,
who gives the sun for light by day
    and the fixed order of the moon and the stars for light by night,
who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar—
    the Lord of hosts is his name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“If this fixed order departs
    from before me, declares the Lord,
then shall the offspring of Israel cease
    from being a nation before me forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord:
“If the heavens above can be measured,
    and the foundations of the earth below can be explored,
then I will cast off all the offspring of Israel
    for all that they have done,
declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when the city shall be rebuilt for the Lord from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the measuring line shall go out farther, straight to the hill Gareb, and shall then turn to Goah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The whole valley of the dead bodies and the ashes, and all the fields as far as the brook Kidron, to the corner of the Horse Gate toward the east, shall be sacred to the Lord. It shall not be plucked up or overthrown anymore forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time the army of the king of Babylon was besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was shut up in the court of the guard that was in the palace of the king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Zedekiah king of Judah had imprisoned him, saying, “Why do you prophesy and say, ‘Thus says the Lord: Behold, I am giving this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall capture it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him face to face and see him eye to eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall take Zedekiah to Babylon, and there he shall remain until I visit him, declares the Lord. Though you fight against the Chaldeans, you shall not succeed’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah said, “The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle will come to you and say, ‘Buy my field that is at Anathoth, for the right of redemption by purchase is yours.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hanamel my cousin came to me in the court of the guard, in accordance with the word of the Lord, and said to me, ‘Buy my field that is at Anathoth in the land of Benjamin, for the right of possession and redemption is yours; buy it for yourself.’ Then I knew that this was the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I bought the field at Anathoth from Hanamel my cousin, and weighed out the money to him, seventeen shekels of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I signed the deed, sealed it, got witnesses, and weighed the money on scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I took the sealed deed of purchase, containing the terms and conditions and the open copy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I gave the deed of purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, in the presence of Hanamel my cousin, in the presence of the witnesses who signed the deed of purchase, and in the presence of all the Judeans who were sitting in the court of the guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I charged Baruch in their presence, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Take these deeds, both this sealed deed of purchase and this open deed, and put them in an earthenware vessel, that they may last for a long time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Houses and fields and vineyards shall again be bought in this land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “After I had given the deed of purchase to Baruch the son of Neriah, I prayed to the Lord, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Ah, Lord God! It is you who have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and by your outstretched arm! Nothing is too hard for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You show steadfast love to thousands, but you repay the guilt of fathers to their children after them, O great and mighty God, whose name is the Lord of hosts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: great in counsel and mighty in deed, whose eyes are open to all the ways of the children of man, rewarding each one according to his ways and according to the fruit of his deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have shown signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, and to this day in Israel and among all mankind, and have made a name for yourself, as at this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You brought your people Israel out of the land of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and outstretched arm, and with great terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you gave them this land, which you swore to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they entered and took possession of it. But they did not obey your voice or walk in your law. They did nothing of all you commanded them to do. Therefore you have made all this disaster come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, the siege mounds have come up to the city to take it, and because of sword and famine and pestilence the city is given into the hands of the Chaldeans who are fighting against it. What you spoke has come to pass, and behold, you see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you, O Lord God, have said to me, “Buy the field for money and get witnesses”—though the city is given into the hands of the Chaldeans.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I am the Lord, the God of all flesh. Is anything too hard for me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, thus says the Lord: Behold, I am giving this city into the hands of the Chaldeans and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Chaldeans who are fighting against this city shall come and set this city on fire and burn it, with the houses on whose roofs offerings have been made to Baal and drink offerings have been poured out to other gods, to provoke me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the children of Israel and the children of Judah have done nothing but evil in my sight from their youth. The children of Israel have done nothing but provoke me to anger by the work of their hands, declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This city has aroused my anger and wrath, from the day it was built to this day, so that I will remove it from my sight
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and the children of Judah that they did to provoke me to anger—their kings and their officials, their priests and their prophets, the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have turned to me their back and not their face. And though I have taught them persistently, they have not listened to receive instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They set up their abominations in the house that is called by my name, to defile it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They built the high places of Baal in the Valley of the Son of Hinnom, to offer up their sons and daughters to Molech, though I did not command them, nor did it enter into my mind, that they should do this abomination, to cause Judah to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning this city of which you say, ‘It is given into the hand of the king of Babylon by sword, by famine, and by pestilence’:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will gather them from all the countries to which I drove them in my anger and my wrath and in great indignation. I will bring them back to this place, and I will make them dwell in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall be my people, and I will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give them one heart and one way, that they may fear me forever, for their own good and the good of their children after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make with them an everlasting covenant, that I will not turn away from doing good to them. And I will put the fear of me in their hearts, that they may not turn from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will rejoice in doing them good, and I will plant them in this land in faithfulness, with all my heart and all my soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: Just as I have brought all this great disaster upon this people, so I will bring upon them all the good that I promise them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fields shall be bought in this land of which you are saying, ‘It is a desolation, without man or beast; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fields shall be bought for money, and deeds shall be signed and sealed and witnessed, in the land of Benjamin, in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, in the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the Shephelah, and in the cities of the Negeb; for I will restore their fortunes, declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still shut up in the court of the guard:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord who made the earth, the Lord who formed it to establish it—the Lord is his name:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Call to me and I will answer you, and will tell you great and hidden things that you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city and the houses of the kings of Judah that were torn down to make a defense against the siege mounds and against the sword:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are coming in to fight against the Chaldeans and to fill them with the dead bodies of men whom I shall strike down in my anger and my wrath, for I have hidden my face from this city because of all their evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will bring to it health and healing, and I will heal them and reveal to them abundance of prosperity and security.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will restore the fortunes of Judah and the fortunes of Israel, and rebuild them as they were at first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cleanse them from all the guilt of their sin against me, and I will forgive all the guilt of their sin and rebellion against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this city shall be to me a name of joy, a praise and a glory before all the nations of the earth who shall hear of all the good that I do for them. They shall fear and tremble because of all the good and all the prosperity I provide for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: In this place of which you say, ‘It is a waste without man or beast,’ in the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem that are desolate, without man or inhabitant or beast, there shall be heard again
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the voices of those who sing, as they bring thank offerings to the house of the Lord:
“‘Give thanks to the Lord of hosts,
    for the Lord is good,
    for his steadfast love endures forever!’
For I will restore the fortunes of the land as at first, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts: In this place that is waste, without man or beast, and in all of its cities, there shall again be habitations of shepherds resting their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the cities of the hill country, in the cities of the Shephelah, and in the cities of the Negeb, in the land of Benjamin, the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, flocks shall again pass under the hands of the one who counts them, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when I will fulfill the promise I made to the house of Israel and the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days and at that time I will cause a righteous Branch to spring up for David, and he shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Judah will be saved, and Jerusalem will dwell securely. And this is the name by which it will be called: ‘The Lord is our righteousness.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord: David shall never lack a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Levitical priests shall never lack a man in my presence to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings, and to make sacrifices forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord: If you can break my covenant with the day and my covenant with the night, so that day and night will not come at their appointed time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then also my covenant with David my servant may be broken, so that he shall not have a son to reign on his throne, and my covenant with the Levitical priests my ministers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered and the sands of the sea cannot be measured, so I will multiply the offspring of David my servant, and the Levitical priests who minister to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you not observed that these people are saying, ‘The Lord has rejected the two clans that he chose’? Thus they have despised my people so that they are no longer a nation in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: If I have not established my covenant with day and night and the fixed order of heaven and earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will reject the offspring of Jacob and David my servant and will not choose one of his offspring to rule over the offspring of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For I will restore their fortunes and will have mercy on them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army and all the kingdoms of the earth under his dominion and all the peoples were fighting against Jerusalem and all of its cities:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord: Behold, I am giving this city into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not escape from his hand but shall surely be captured and delivered into his hand. You shall see the king of Babylon eye to eye and speak with him face to face. And you shall go to Babylon.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet hear the word of the Lord, O Zedekiah king of Judah! Thus says the Lord concerning you: ‘You shall not die by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall die in peace. And as spices were burned for your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so people shall burn spices for you and lament for you, saying, “Alas, lord!”’ For I have spoken the word, declares the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah the prophet spoke all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah, in Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when the army of the king of Babylon was fighting against Jerusalem and against all the cities of Judah that were left, Lachish and Azekah, for these were the only fortified cities of Judah that remained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord, after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to make a proclamation of liberty to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that everyone should set free his Hebrew slaves, male and female, so that no one should enslave a Jew, his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they obeyed, all the officials and all the people who had entered into the covenant that everyone would set free his slave, male or female, so that they would not be enslaved again. They obeyed and set them free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward they turned around and took back the male and female slaves they had set free, and brought them into subjection as slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to Jeremiah from the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: I myself made a covenant with your fathers when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘At the end of seven years each of you must set free the fellow Hebrew who has been sold to you and has served you six years; you must set him free from your service.’ But your fathers did not listen to me or incline their ears to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You recently repented and did what was right in my eyes by proclaiming liberty, each to his neighbor, and you made a covenant before me in the house that is called by my name,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but then you turned around and profaned my name when each of you took back his male and female slaves, whom you had set free according to their desire, and you brought them into subjection to be your slaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, thus says the Lord: You have not obeyed me by proclaiming liberty, every one to his brother and to his neighbor; behold, I proclaim to you liberty to the sword, to pestilence, and to famine, declares the Lord. I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men who transgressed my covenant and did not keep the terms of the covenant that they made before me, I will make them like the calf that they cut in two and passed between its parts—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the officials of Judah, the officials of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, the priests, and all the people of the land who passed between the parts of the calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give them into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their lives. Their dead bodies shall be food for the birds of the air and the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials I will give into the hand of their enemies and into the hand of those who seek their lives, into the hand of the army of the king of Babylon which has withdrawn from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will command, declares the Lord, and will bring them back to this city. And they will fight against it and take it and burn it with fire. I will make the cities of Judah a desolation without inhabitant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word that came to Jeremiah from the Lord in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go to the house of the Rechabites and speak with them and bring them to the house of the Lord, into one of the chambers; then offer them wine to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took Jaazaniah the son of Jeremiah, son of Habazziniah and his brothers and all his sons and the whole house of the Rechabites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought them to the house of the Lord into the chamber of the sons of Hanan the son of Igdaliah, the man of God, which was near the chamber of the officials, above the chamber of Maaseiah the son of Shallum, keeper of the threshold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I set before the Rechabites pitchers full of wine, and cups, and I said to them, “Drink wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they answered, “We will drink no wine, for Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, commanded us, ‘You shall not drink wine, neither you nor your sons forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not build a house; you shall not sow seed; you shall not plant or have a vineyard; but you shall live in tents all your days, that you may live many days in the land where you sojourn.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have obeyed the voice of Jonadab the son of Rechab, our father, in all that he commanded us, to drink no wine all our days, ourselves, our wives, our sons, or our daughters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not to build houses to dwell in. We have no vineyard or field or seed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we have lived in tents and have obeyed and done all that Jonadab our father commanded us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against the land, we said, ‘Come, and let us go to Jerusalem for fear of the army of the Chaldeans and the army of the Syrians.’ So we are living in Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Go and say to the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, Will you not receive instruction and listen to my words? declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The command that Jonadab the son of Rechab gave to his sons, to drink no wine, has been kept, and they drink none to this day, for they have obeyed their father's command. I have spoken to you persistently, but you have not listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent to you all my servants the prophets, sending them persistently, saying, ‘Turn now every one of you from his evil way, and amend your deeds, and do not go after other gods to serve them, and then you shall dwell in the land that I gave to you and your fathers.’ But you did not incline your ear or listen to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have kept the command that their father gave them, but this people has not obeyed me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, thus says the Lord, the God of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I am bringing upon Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem all the disaster that I have pronounced against them, because I have spoken to them and they have not listened, I have called to them and they have not answered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the house of the Rechabites Jeremiah said, “Thus says the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel: Because you have obeyed the command of Jonadab your father and kept all his precepts and done all that he commanded you,
verses.speaker: Narrator
